definition: to conceal/to hide behind/to cover up

sentences.english: I want to but Ihave no idea that nothing can cover my enthusiasm .
sentences.chinese: 我想但是沒有東西可以掩蓋我的熱情。

sentences.english: The cons cover the hole and hide the concrete.
sentences.chinese: 團伙們掩蓋了洞口將混凝土藏好。

sentences.english: The earth was as completely cloud-shrouded as normally is the planet Venus.
sentences.chinese: 整個地球就像金星平時那樣完全被雲霧掩蓋着。

sentences.english: The running water of the shower disguises your glory moans.
sentences.chinese: 水流聲會掩蓋住你的呻吟聲。

sentences.english: There is no disguising the fact that … …
What if he used cedarwood to hide the pot smell?
sentences.chinese: 若他用香柏掩蓋大麻的氣味呢？

sentences.english: Don't let the noise of others' opinions down out your own inner voice.
sentences.chinese: 別讓他人之見的噪音掩蓋了自己來自於心底的聲音。

sentences.english: Reduce redness by using a green shades.
sentences.chinese: 用綠色打出陰影來掩蓋皮膚髮紅。

sentences.english: Magnitude is not to be confused with obscuration, which measures the fraction of area covered.
sentences.chinese: 食分和掩蓋面積比的定義並不相同。
這幅夢幻般的照片下面掩蓋着悲劇。

sentences.english: Wearing too much make-up can mask the scent that attracts men during ovulation.
sentences.chinese: 濃妝會掩蓋排卵期女性特有的吸引男人的氣味。

sentences.english: Zhou, who had first put that idea forward, hid his boredom behind an indulgent smile.
sentences.chinese: 最早提出這個概念的周以寬容的微笑掩蓋了他的厭煩。

sentences.english: As Camby continued, it was hard for him to hide his playoff disappointment.
sentences.chinese: 他顯然不能掩蓋他對這些年掘金季後賽表現的失望。

sentences.english: She manufactured a false story to hide the facts.
sentences.chinese: 她編造瞎話以掩蓋事實。

sentences.english: He tried to stay his joy, but couldn't help laughing.
sentences.chinese: 他試圖掩蓋住他的喜悅，可還是忍不住笑了起來。

sentences.english: That allows banks to cover up some deficiencies.
sentences.chinese: 這樣銀行就得以掩蓋一些不足之處。

definition: to cover up/to conceal/to mask/to gloss over
to hide/to conceal/to mask/to shelter/to harbor (i.e. keep sth hidden)/to hide oneself/to lie low/to nestle/hidden/implicit/private/covert/recessed (lighting)
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
